abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is equal to another given object.
overview:
## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if the receiver is equal to `object`, otherwise [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO]. In effect returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO] if receiver is `nil`.

## Discussion

During the evaluation of an `NSWhoseSpecifier` object that contains a test whose operator is `NSEqualToComparison`, an [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/isEqual(to:)] message may be sent to each potentially specified object, if neither the potentially specified object nor the object being tested against implements a [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/scriptingIsEqual(to:)] method.

The default implementation for this method provided by `NSObject` returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if an `isEqualTo:` message sent to the same object would return [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES].

# isEqual(to:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is equal to another given object.

## Declaration

```swift
func isEqual(to object: Any?) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **object**: The object with which to compare the receiver.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if the receiver is equal to `object`, otherwise [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO]. In effect returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO] if receiver is `nil`.

## Discussion

During the evaluation of an `NSWhoseSpecifier` object that contains a test whose operator is `NSEqualToComparison`, an [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/isEqual(to:)] message may be sent to each potentially specified object, if neither the potentially specified object nor the object being tested against implements a [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/scriptingIsEqual(to:)] method.

The default implementation for this method provided by `NSObject` returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if an `isEqualTo:` message sent to the same object would return [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES].
title: isEqual(to:)
